description.raw:
This PR adds usage of interpolate\_x SDF parameter for actor animations.  
Previously, the model pose was computed in a bit of a hacky way depending on a hardcoded distance threshold of 0.1, less than threshold resulted in normal animation playback, greater than threshold automatically switched to X interpolated animation, ignoring the sdf tag.

This PR removes the hack and uses the sdf tag instead to determine the animation playback speed, in a way similar to how it is [currently done in gazebo](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/src/c1537db2c8550db2566a634fcee382a7ab6d7fbe/gazebo/physics/Actor.cc#lines-778).

Targeting default because it might break existing behavior and it requires an ABI \(I believe\) breaking change in ign-common that will need to target default as well.

I’m not particularly happy with the “-1” hack, but it’s the only way I could get this to work in this example.

To test I used the actor.sdf example world, changing the model.sdf for the actor to the following:

```xml
<?xml version="1.0" ?>
<sdf version="1.6">
    <actor name="actor_test">
        <pose>0 0 1.0 0 0 0</pose>
        <skin>
            <filename>file:///home/luca/.ignition/fuel/fuel.ignitionrobotics.org/Mingfei/models/actor/1//meshes/walk.dae</filename>
            <scale>1.0</scale>
        </skin>
        <animation name="walk_ni">
            <filename>file:///home/luca/.ignition/fuel/fuel.ignitionrobotics.org/Mingfei/models/actor/1//meshes/walk.dae</filename>
            <scale>1.0</scale>
            <interpolate_x>false</interpolate_x>
        </animation><animation name="walk">
            <filename>file:///home/luca/.ignition/fuel/fuel.ignitionrobotics.org/Mingfei/models/actor/1//meshes/walk.dae</filename>
            <scale>1.0</scale>
            <interpolate_x>true</interpolate_x>
        </animation>
        <script>
            <loop>true</loop>
            <delay_start>1.0</delay_start>
            <auto_start>true</auto_start>
            <trajectory id="4" type="walk_ni">
                <waypoint>
                    <time>0</time>
                    <pose>0 0 1.0 0 0 1.57</pose>
                </waypoint>
                <waypoint>
                    <time>4</time>
                    <pose>0 4 1.0 0 0 1.57</pose>
                </waypoint>
            </trajectory>
            <trajectory id="5" type="walk">
                <waypoint>
                    <time>0</time>
                    <pose>0 4 1.0 0 0 -1.57</pose>
                </waypoint>
                <waypoint>
                    <time>4</time>
                    <pose>0 0 1.0 0 0 -1.57</pose>
                </waypoint>
            </trajectory>
        </script>
    </actor>
</sdf>
```

Result is the following, before the PRs \(interpolate\_x tag is ignored\):

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/8zodKzn/images/3559567351-actor_before_pr.gif)
And after \(the tag is used\):

![](data/bitbucket.org/repo/8zodKzn/images/3624619904-actor_post_pr.gif)
Depends on ign-common PR [#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-common/pull-requests/232](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-common/pull-requests/232)

This PR adds usage of interpolate_x SDF parameter for actor animations.
Previously, the model pose was computed in a bit of a hacky way depending on a hardcoded distance threshold of 0.1, less than threshold resulted in normal animation playback, greater than threshold automatically switched to X interpolated animation, ignoring the sdf tag.

This PR removes the hack and uses the sdf tag instead to determine the animation playback speed, in a way similar to how it is currently done in gazebo.

Targeting default because it might break existing behavior and it requires an ABI (I believe) breaking change in ign-common that will need to target default as well.

I’m not particularly happy with the “-1” hack, but it’s the only way I could get this to work in this example.

To test I used the actor.sdf example world, changing the model.sdf for the actor to the following:

                </waypoint>
            </trajectory>
        </script>
    </actor>
</sdf>

Result is the following, before the PRs (interpolate_x tag is ignored):

And after (the tag is used):

Depends on ign-common PR #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-common/pull-requests/232

title.raw: Using interpolate_x sdf value for animation playback speed

Previously, the model pose was computed in a bit of a hacky way depending on a hardcoded distance threshold of 0.1, less than threshold resulted in normal animation playback, greater than threshold automatically switched to X interpolated animation, ignoring the sdf tag.
